body.p: The function of the whole nervous system is to receive input about changes in the internal and external environment, integrate and coordinate that input, and generate an output. This mirrors the components of homeostatic mechanisms. The single neuron (cell) is well suited because its different parts serve these functions on a smaller scale:
Which part of the neuron receives chemical input, either serving as or associated with a “receptor”?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This would send an electrical input away from cell body if reach threshold.
Incorrect. This would get the electrical input from one or more of these parts.
Correct. This would send information toward the cell body.

question.body: Which part of the neuron conducts electrical impulses?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This would send an electrical input away from cell body if reach threshold.
Correct. This would get the electrical input from one or more cell extensions that converted chemical input to electrical.
Incorrect. This would convert chemical to electrical impulse that is then sent toward the cell body.

question.body: Which part of the neuron sends output to "effector"?

response.feedback: Correct. If threshold is reached at cell body this carries the action potential to its synaptic terminal to stimulate another neuron or effector.
Incorrect. This would get the electrical input and send it to this part if threshold is reached.
Incorrect. This would convert chemical to electrical impulse that is then sent toward the cell body.
